instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Will not boot into OS off any HD
threads.message: Have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with computer not booting claims she "crashed it" moving pictures around. Her HD boots externally, so I ruled that out. Her computer will not boot with any of my test drives, a known GOOD SATA cable, a known GOOD battery, or a known GOOD 85 Magsafe with and without the battery plugged in. I have seen the many topics regarding <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> in GPU panics and things like that, but I'm just curious can that cause the computer to not boot period? No evidence of any liquid damage anywhere on the board or in the machine has had the battery replaced before with a 3rd party battery, but even an Apple known good doesn't  boot the machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Will not boot into OS off any HD
threads.message: Actually my bad <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> on this board it looks like

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Will not boot into OS off any HD
threads.message: GPU is bad, <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is only on 2850 boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Will not boot into OS off any HD
threads.message: Oh ok I just wanted to make sure well that sucks :/ thanks tho Duke appreciate it!
